investment_opportunities.description: Conversely, developments that ignore the emerging standards face slow permits, higher insurance, and eroding asset values

risk_factors.description: ** A 2025 state law lets licensed engineers perform plan review when the city fails to act within two business days, after which construction may start immediately—further de-risking timelines[^22]
** Carriers now discount premiums for projects that integrate bioretention and elevated mechanical rooms within 500-year floodplains—an implicit carbon-risk price[^8]

## Conclusion

Houston has moved from aspirational green goals to a layered system of **carrots (tax abatements, C-PACE, 179D)** and **sticks (stricter 2021 codes, flood-risk disclosures, optional EV/solar appendices)** that shape every stage of real-estate development

Projects that design for LEED or GSI, pre-wire for chargers, and integrate rooftop PV can now lower both construction financing costs and long-term operating expenses, while de-risking exposure to future carbon regulations
